# SAFER Program Funding Amounts & Cycles (2026)

## Annual Funding

### Safe and Affordable Drinking Water Fund
- **$130 million annually** for 10 years
- Started FY 2020-21
- Source: Greenhouse Gas Reduction Fund (Cap and Trade)
- Administered through the [SAFER Program](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/safer/)

### Current Funding Challenges
- Program faces ~$100 million shortfall over next 4 years
- Reduced Cap and Trade auction revenues
- Approximately $20 million shifted to emergency water provision
- ~860 households currently receiving state-supported hauled water

## Funding Types Available

### Grants (No Repayment)
- Emergency water supplies
- Planning and technical assistance
- DAC/SDAC construction projects
- Operations and maintenance support

### Principal Forgiveness
- Portion of loan forgiven
- Available through [DWSRF](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/drinking_water/services/funding/SRF.html) combination
- Up to 100% for eligible communities

### Low-Interest Loans
- DWSRF rates: ~1.9% (half of GO bond rate)
- Terms up to 30-40 years
- Combined with grant/forgiveness

## Typical Funding Ranges

### Emergency/Interim
| Project Type | Typical Range |
|--------------|---------------|
| Hauled water | $50-200/household/month |
| Emergency repairs | $10,000 - $500,000 |
| Interim treatment | $50,000 - $2 million |

### Technical Assistance
| Service | Typical Range |
|---------|---------------|
| Compliance assessment | $5,000 - $25,000 |
| Engineering planning | $25,000 - $200,000 |
| Rate studies | $10,000 - $50,000 |

### Construction
| Project Type | Typical Range |
|--------------|---------------|
| Small system (<100 connections) | $100,000 - $2 million |
| Medium system (100-500 connections) | $500,000 - $10 million |
| Consolidation projects | $1 million - $50 million+ |

## Funding Cycles

### Continuous Funding
- Emergency requests: Rolling, no deadline
- Technical assistance: Rolling
- Operations & maintenance: Rolling

### Project Funding
- Annual budget cycle (July 1 - June 30)
- Funding agreement execution varies
- Multi-year projects common

## Cost Share Requirements

### For DAC/SDAC Projects
- Often 100% grant funding
- No local match required

### For Non-DAC Projects
- May require local contribution
- Financing terms vary
- Lower priority than DAC/SDAC

## Related Funding Programs

SAFER can be combined with:
- [DWSRF](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/drinking_water/services/funding/SRF.html) loans and principal forgiveness
- Proposition 1 funds
- Proposition 68 funds
- Federal Infrastructure Law funding

For budget and advocacy context, see [Community Water Center press releases](https://www.communitywatercenter.org/press-releases/state-budget).

## Take Action

1. **Review funding options** -- Visit the [SAFER Program](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/safer/) page to understand available grant types, loan terms, and which funding mechanism fits your project.
2. **Explore DWSRF financing** -- Check the [Drinking Water State Revolving Fund](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/drinking_water/services/funding/SRF.html) for low-interest loan rates and principal forgiveness options that can be combined with SAFER.
3. **Apply through FAAST** -- Submit your application at [FAAST](https://faast.waterboards.ca.gov), the online portal for all State Water Board financial assistance programs.
4. **Contact Financial Assistance** -- Call (916) 341-5700 to discuss funding availability, application timelines, and how to combine multiple funding sources for your project.
